ObserveEventBusResponse.title: Observe Event Bus Response
ObserveEventBusResponse.description: Response to a subscribed stream of events from the Vega event bus

operator.title: Operator
operator.description: Comparator describes the type of comparison.

value.description: value is used by the comparator.

oracles.v1.Condition.title: Condition
oracles.v1.Condition.description: Condition describes the condition that must be validated by the

key.description: key is the oracle data property key targeted by the filter.

conditions.description: conditions are the conditions that should be matched by the data to be considered of interest.

oracles.v1.Filter.title: Filter
oracles.v1.Filter.description: Filter describes the conditions under which an oracle data is considered of interest or not.

pub_keys.description: pubKeys is the list of authorized public keys that signed the data for this oracle. All the public keys in the oracle data should be contained in these public keys.

data.description: data holds all the properties of the oracle data

matched_spec_ids.description: matched_specs_ids lists all the oracle specs that matched this oracle data.

broadcast_at.description: broadcast_at is the time at which the data was broadcast for the first time.

oracles.v1.OracleData.title: Oracle Data
oracles.v1.OracleData.description: OracleData describes an oracle data that has been broadcast.

id.description: id is a hash generated from the OracleSpec data.

pub_keys.description: pubKeys is the list of authorized public keys that signed the data for this oracle. All the public keys in the oracle data should be contained in these public keys.

filters.description: filters describes which oracle data are considered of interest or not for the product (or the risk model).

status.title: Status
status.description: Status describe the status of the oracle spec

oracles.v1.OracleSpec.title: Oracle Spec
oracles.v1.OracleSpec.description: An oracle spec describe the oracle data that a product (or a risk model) wants to get from the oracle engine. This message contains additional information used by the API.

pub_keys.description: pubKeys is the list of authorized public keys that signed the data for this oracle. All the public keys in the oracle data should be contained in these public keys.

filters.description: filters describes which oracle data are considered of interest or not for the product (or the risk model).

oracles.v1.OracleSpecConfiguration.title: Oracle Spec Configuration
oracles.v1.OracleSpecConfiguration.description: An oracle spec describe the oracle data that a product (or a risk model) wants to get from the oracle engine.

name.description: name is the name of the property.

value.description: value is the value of the property.

oracles.v1.Property.title: Property
oracles.v1.Property.description: Property describes one property of an oracle spec with a key with its value.

name.description: name is the name of the property.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type describes the type of properties that are supported by the oracle engine.

oracles.v1.PropertyKey.title: Property Key
oracles.v1.PropertyKey.description: PropertyKey describes the property key contained in an oracle data.

id.description: Unique account identifier (used internally by Vega)

owner.description: The party that the account belongs to, special values include `network`, which represents the Vega network and is most commonly seen during liquidation of distressed trading positions

balance.description: Balance of the asset, the balance is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places and importantly balances cannot be negative

market_id.description: Market identifier for the account, if [`AccountType`](#vega.AccountType).`ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL` this will be empty

type.title: Account Type
type.description: Various collateral/account types as used by Vega

vega.Account.title: Account
vega.Account.description: Represents an account for an asset on Vega for a particular owner or party

details.description: The definition of the external source for this asset

vega.Asset.title: Asset
vega.Asset.description: The Vega representation of an external asset

name.description: Name of the asset (e.g: Great British Pound)

total_supply.description: Total circulating supply for the asset

decimals.description: Number of decimal / precision handled by this asset

quantum.description: The minimum economically meaningful amount in the asset

vega.AssetDetails.title: Asset Details
vega.AssetDetails.description: The Vega representation of an external asset

duration.description: Duration of the auction in seconds

vega.AuctionDuration.title: Auction Duration
vega.AuctionDuration.description: An auction duration is used to configure 3 auction periods: 1. `duration > 0`, `volume == 0`:   The auction will last for at least N seconds 2. `duration == 0`, `volume > 0`:   The auction will end once we can close with given traded volume 3. `duration > 0`, `volume > 0`:   The auction will take at least N seconds, but can end sooner if we can trade a certain volume

max_faucet_amount_mint.description: Maximum amount that can be requested by a party through the built-in asset faucet at a time

party_id.description: Party identifier of the user initiating the deposit

asset.description: The Vega asset targeted by this deposit

tx_hash.description: The hash of the transaction from the foreign chain

credited_timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the Vega account was updated with the deposit

created_timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the deposit was created on the Vega network

vega.Deposit.title: Deposit
vega.Deposit.description: A deposit on to the Vega network

contract_address.description: The address of the contract for the token, on the ethereum network

vega.ERC20.title: ERC 20
vega.ERC20.description: An ERC20 token based asset, living on the ethereum network

receiver_address.description: The address into which the bridge will release the funds

vega.Erc20WithdrawExt.title: Erc 20 Withdraw Ext
vega.Erc20WithdrawExt.description: An extension of data required for the withdraw submissions

maker_fee.description: Fee amount paid to the non-aggressive party of the trade

infrastructure_fee.description: Fee amount paid for maintaining the Vega infrastructure

liquidity_fee.description: Fee amount paid to market makers

vega.Fee.title: Fee
vega.Fee.description: Represents any fees paid by a party, resulting from a trade

oracle_spec_for_settlement_price.description: The oracle spec describing the settlement price oracle filter

oracle_spec_for_trading_termination.description: the oracle spec describing the trading termination oracle filter

oracle_spec_binding.description: The binding between the oracle spec and the oracle data

oracle_spec_for_settlement_price.description: The oracle spec describing the oracle data of settlement price

oracle_spec_for_trading_termination.description: The oracle spec describing the oracle data of trading termination

oracle_spec_binding.description: The binding between the oracle spec and the settlement price

tags.description: A list of 0 or more tags

from_account.description: One or more accounts to transfer from

to_account.description: One or more accounts to transfer to

timestamp.description: Timestamp for the time the ledger entry was created, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

vega.LedgerEntry.title: Ledger Entry
vega.LedgerEntry.description: Represents a ledger entry on Vega

target_stake_parameters.description: Specifies parameters related to target stake calculation

triggering_ratio.description: Specifies the triggering ratio for entering liquidity auction

auction_extension.description: Specifies by how many seconds an auction should be extended if leaving the auction were to trigger a liquidity auction

vega.LiquidityMonitoringParameters.title: Liquidity Monitoring Parameters
vega.LiquidityMonitoringParameters.description: LiquidityMonitoringParameters contains settings used for liquidity monitoring

reference.title: Pegged Reference
reference.description: A pegged reference defines which price point a pegged order is linked to - meaning the price for a pegged order is calculated from the value of the reference price point

proportion.description: The relative proportion of the commitment to be allocated at a price level

offset.description: The offset/amount of units away for the order

order_id.description: Unique identifier of the pegged order generated by the core to fulfil this liquidity order

liquidity_order.description: The liquidity order from the original submission

vega.LiquidityOrderReference.title: Liquidity Order Reference
vega.LiquidityOrderReference.description: A pair of a liquidity order and the id of the generated order by the core

equity_like_share.description: The share own by this liquidity provider (float)

average_entry_valuation.description: The average entry valuation of the liquidity provider for the market

vega.LiquidityProviderFeeShare.title: Liquidity Provider Fee Share
vega.LiquidityProviderFeeShare.description: The equity like share of liquidity fee for each liquidity provider

party_id.description: Unique party identifier for the creator of the provision

created_at.description: Timestamp for when the order was created at, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when the order was updated at, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

market_id.description: Market identifier for the order, required field

commitment_amount.description: Specified as a unitless number that represents the amount of settlement asset of the market

fee.description: Nominated liquidity fee factor, which is an input to the calculation of taker fees on the market, as per seeting fees and rewarding liquidity providers

sells.description: A set of liquidity sell orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

buys.description: A set of liquidity buy orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

version.description: Version of this liquidity provision order

status.title: Status
status.description: Status of a liquidity provision order

reference.description: A reference shared between this liquidity provision and all it's orders

vega.LogNormalModelParams.title: Log Normal Model Params
vega.LogNormalModelParams.description: Risk model parameters for log normal

params.description: Risk model parameters for log normal

timestamp.description: Timestamp for the time the ledger entry was created, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

vega.MarginLevels.title: Margin Levels
vega.MarginLevels.description: Represents the margin levels for a party on a market at a given time

decimal_places.description: Number of decimal places that a price must be shifted by in order to get a correct price denominated in the currency of the market, for example: `realPrice = price / 10^decimalPlaces`

opening_auction.description: Auction duration specifies how long the opening auction will run (minimum duration and optionally a minimum traded volume)

trading_mode.title: Trading Mode
trading_mode.description: The trading mode the market is currently running, also referred to as 'market state'

state.title: State
state.description: The current state of the Market

market_timestamps.description: Timestamps for when the market stay changes

position_decimal_places.description: The number of decimal places for position

mark_price.description: Mark price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

best_bid_price.description: Highest price level on an order book for buy orders, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

best_bid_volume.description: Aggregated volume being bid at the best bid price

best_offer_price.description: Lowest price level on an order book for offer orders

best_offer_volume.description: Aggregated volume being offered at the best offer price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly  // formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

best_static_bid_price.description: Highest price on the order book for buy orders not including pegged orders

best_static_bid_volume.description: Total volume at the best static bid price excluding pegged orders

best_static_offer_price.description: Lowest price on the order book for sell orders not including pegged orders

best_static_offer_volume.description: Total volume at the best static offer price excluding pegged orders

mid_price.description: Arithmetic average of the best bid price and best offer price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

static_mid_price.description: Arithmetic average of the best static bid price and best static offer price

timestamp.description: Timestamp at which this mark price was relevant, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

open_interest.description: The sum of the size of all positions greater than 0 on the market

auction_end.description: Time in seconds until the end of the auction (0 if currently not in auction period)

auction_start.description: Time until next auction (used in FBA's) - currently always 0

indicative_price.description: Indicative price (zero if not in auction)

indicative_volume.description: Indicative volume (zero if not in auction)

market_trading_mode.title: Trading Mode
market_trading_mode.description: The trading mode the market is currently running, also referred to as 'market state'

trigger.title: Auction Trigger
trigger.description: Auction triggers indicate what condition triggered an auction (if market is in auction mode)

extension_trigger.title: Auction Trigger
extension_trigger.description: Auction triggers indicate what condition triggered an auction (if market is in auction mode)

target_stake.description: Targeted stake for the given market

supplied_stake.description: Available stake for the given market

price_monitoring_bounds.description: One or more price monitoring bounds for the current timestamp

liquidity_provider_fee_share.description: the equity like share of liquidity fee for each liquidity provider

vega.MarketData.title: Market Data
vega.MarketData.description: Represents data generated by a market when open

proposed.description: Time when the market is first proposed

pending.description: Time when the market has been voted in and is created into an opening auction

open.description: Time when the market has left the opening auction and is ready to accept trades

close.description: Time when the market is closed

vega.MarketTimestamps.title: Market Timestamps
vega.MarketTimestamps.description: Time stamps for important times about creating, enacting etc the market

can_propose_market.description: Are market proposals allowed at this point in time

can_propose_asset.description: Are asset proposals allowed at this point in time

propose_market_enabled.description: Are market proposals enabled on this chain

propose_asset_enabled.description: Are asset proposals enabled on this chain

bootstrap_block_count.description: How many blocks before the chain comes out of bootstrap mode

genesis_loaded.description: True once the genesis file is loaded

propose_market_enabled_from.description: The date/timestamp in unix nanoseconds at which market proposals will be enabled (0 indicates not set)

propose_asset_enabled_from.description: The date/timestamp in unix nanoseconds at which asset proposals will be enabled (0 indicates not set)

vega.NetworkLimits.title: Network Limits
vega.NetworkLimits.description: Network limits, defined in the genesis file

value.description: The value for the network parameter

vega.NetworkParameter.title: Network Parameter
vega.NetworkParameter.description: Represents a network parameter on Vega

changes.description: The configuration of the new asset
The configuration of the new freeform

url.description: The URL containing content that describes the proposal

description.description: A short description of what is being proposed

hash.description: The hash on the content of the URL

changes.description: The configuration of the new market

liquidity_commitment.description: The commitment from the party creating the NewMarket proposal

commitment_amount.description: Specified as a unitless number that represents the amount of settlement asset of the market

fee.description: Nominated liquidity fee factor, which is an input to the calculation of taker fees on the market, as per seeting fees and rewarding liquidity providers

sells.description: A set of liquidity sell orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

buys.description: A set of liquidity buy orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

reference.description: A reference to be associated to all orders created from this commitment

vega.NewMarketCommitment.title: New Market Commitment
vega.NewMarketCommitment.description: A commitment of liquidity to be made by the party which proposes a market

decimal_places.description: Decimal places used for the new market

metadata.description: Optional new market meta data, tags

simple.description: Simple risk model parameters, valid only if MODEL_SIMPLE is selected

log_normal.description: Log normal risk model parameters, valid only if MODEL_LOG_NORMAL is selected

vega.NewMarketConfiguration.title: New Market Configuration
vega.NewMarketConfiguration.description: Configuration for a new market on Vega

settlement_price_property.description: settlement_price_property holds the name of the property in the oracle data that should be used as settlement price. If it is set to "prices.BTC.value", then the Future will use the value of this property as settlement price.

trading_termination_property.description: the name of the property in the oracle data that signals termination of trading

vega.OracleSpecToFutureBinding.title: Oracle Spec To Future Binding
vega.OracleSpecToFutureBinding.description: OracleSpecToFutureBinding tells on which property oracle data should be used as settlement price and which to use the trading terminated trigger

id.description: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus)

side.title: Side
side.description: A side relates to the direction of an order, to Buy, or Sell

price.description: Price for the order, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

size.description: Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts

remaining.description: Size remaining, when this reaches 0 then the order is fully filled and status becomes STATUS_FILLED

time_in_force.title: Time In Force
time_in_force.description: Time In Force for an order See [What order types are available to trade on Vega?](https://docs.testnet.vega.xyz/docs/trading-questions/#what-order-types-are-available-to-trade-on-vega) for more detail

created_at.description: Timestamp for when the order was created at, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

status.title: Status
status.description: Status values for an order See resulting status in [What order types are available to trade on Vega?](https://docs.testnet.vega.xyz/docs/trading-questions/#what-order-types-are-available-to-trade-on-vega) for more detail.

expires_at.description: Timestamp for when the order will expire, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`, valid only for [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)`.TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT`

reference.description: Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus - Currently set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission

reason.title: Order Error
reason.description: OrderError codes are returned in the `[Order](#vega.Order).reason` field - If there is an issue with an order during its life-cycle, it will be marked with `status.ORDER_STATUS_REJECTED`

updated_at.description: Timestamp for when the Order was last updated, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

version.description: The version for the order, initial value is version 1 and is incremented after each successful amend

batch_id.description: Batch identifier for the order, used internally for orders submitted during auctions to keep track of the auction batch this order falls under (required for fees calculation)

pegged_order.description: Pegged order details, used only if the order represents a pegged order.

liquidity_provision_id.description: Is this order created as part of a liquidity provision, will be empty if not.

vega.Order.title: Order
vega.Order.description: An order can be submitted, amended and cancelled on Vega in an attempt to make trades with other parties

id.description: A unique identifier for the party, typically represented by a public key

vega.Party.title: Party
vega.Party.description: A party represents an entity who wishes to trade on or query a Vega network

reference.title: Pegged Reference
reference.description: A pegged reference defines which price point a pegged order is linked to - meaning the price for a pegged order is calculated from the value of the reference price point

vega.PeggedOrder.title: Pegged Order
vega.PeggedOrder.description: Pegged orders are limit orders where the price is specified in the form REFERENCE +/- OFFSET They can be used for any limit order that is valid during continuous trading

value.description: Price value, given as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

min_valid_price.description: Minimum price that isn't currently breaching the specified price monitoring trigger

max_valid_price.description: Maximum price that isn't currently breaching the specified price monitoring trigger

trigger.description: Price monitoring trigger associated with the bounds

reference_price.description: Reference price used to calculate the valid price range

vega.PriceMonitoringBounds.title: Price Monitoring Bounds
vega.PriceMonitoringBounds.description: Represents a list of valid (at the current timestamp) price ranges per associated trigger

vega.PriceMonitoringParameters.title: Price Monitoring Parameters
vega.PriceMonitoringParameters.description: PriceMonitoringParameters contains a collection of triggers to be used for a given market

parameters.description: Specifies price monitoring parameters to be used for price monitoring purposes

update_frequency.description: Specifies how often (expressed in seconds) the price monitoring bounds should be updated

vega.PriceMonitoringSettings.title: Price Monitoring Settings
vega.PriceMonitoringSettings.description: PriceMonitoringSettings contains the settings for price monitoring

horizon.description: Price monitoring projection horizon  in seconds

auction_extension.description: Price monitoring auction extension duration in seconds should the price breach it's theoretical level over the specified horizon at the specified probability level

vega.PriceMonitoringTrigger.title: Price Monitoring Trigger
vega.PriceMonitoringTrigger.description: PriceMonitoringTrigger holds together price projection horizon , probability level p, and auction extension duration

party_id.description: Party identifier of the author (the party submitting the proposal)

state.title: State
state.description: Proposal state transition: Open ->   - Passed -> Enacted.   - Passed -> Failed.   - Declined Rejected Proposal can enter Failed state from any other state

timestamp.description: Proposal timestamp for date and time (in nanoseconds) when proposal was submitted to the network

terms.description: Proposal configuration and the actual change that is meant to be executed when proposal is enacted

reason.title: Proposal Error
reason.description: A list of possible errors that can cause a proposal to be in state rejected or failed

error_details.description: The detailed error associated to the reason.

closing_timestamp.description: Timestamp (Unix time in seconds) when voting closes for this proposal, constrained by `minClose` and `maxClose` network parameters

enactment_timestamp.description: Timestamp (Unix time in seconds) when proposal gets enacted (if passed), constrained by `minEnact` and `maxEnact` network parameters

update_market.description: Proposal change for modifying an existing market on Vega

new_market.description: Proposal change for creating new market on Vega

update_network_parameter.description: Proposal change for updating Vega network parameters

new_asset.description: Proposal change for creating new assets on Vega

new_freeform.description: Proposal change for a freeform voting thing

vega.ProposalTerms.title: Proposal Terms
vega.ProposalTerms.description: Terms for a governance proposal on Vega

market.description: Market ID that relates to this risk factor

vega.RiskFactor.title: Risk Factor
vega.RiskFactor.description: Risk factors are used to calculate the current risk associated with orders trading on a given market

vega.ScalingFactors.title: Scaling Factors
vega.ScalingFactors.description: Scaling Factors (for use in margin calculation)

factor_long.description: Pre-defined risk factor value for long

factor_short.description: Pre-defined risk factor value for short

max_move_up.description: Pre-defined maximum price move up that the model considers as valid

min_move_down.description: Pre-defined minimum price move down that the model considers as valid

vega.SimpleModelParams.title: Simple Model Params
vega.SimpleModelParams.description: Risk model parameters for simple modelling

params.description: Risk model params for simple modelling

time_window.description: Specifies length of time window expressed in seconds for target stake calculation

scaling_factor.description: Specifies scaling factors used in target stake calculation

vega.TargetStakeParameters.title: Target Stake Parameters
vega.TargetStakeParameters.description: TargetStakeParameters contains parameters used in target stake calculation

vega.Timestamp.title: Timestamp
vega.Timestamp.description: A timestamp in nanoseconds since epoch See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

id.description: Unique identifier for the trade (generated by Vega)

market_id.description: Market identifier (the market that the trade occurred on)

price.description: Price for the trade, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

buyer.description: Unique party identifier for the buyer

seller.description: Unique party identifier for the seller

aggressor.title: Side
aggressor.description: A side relates to the direction of an order, to Buy, or Sell

buy_order.description: Identifier of the order from the buy side

sell_order.description: Identifier of the order from the sell side

timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the trade occurred, in nanoseconds since the epoch - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

buyer_fee.description: Fee amount charged to the buyer party for the trade

seller_fee.description: Fee amount charged to the seller party for the trade

buyer_auction_batch.description: Auction batch number that the buy side order was placed in

seller_auction_batch.description: Auction batch number that the sell side order was placed in

vega.Trade.title: Trade
vega.Trade.description: A trade occurs when an aggressive order crosses one or more passive orders on the order book for a market on Vega

account.description: The account relating to the transfer

balance.description: The balance relating to the transfer

vega.TransferBalance.title: Transfer Balance
vega.TransferBalance.description: Represents the balance for an account during a transfer

transfers.description: One or more ledger entries representing the transfers

vega.TransferResponse.title: Transfer Response
vega.TransferResponse.description: Represents the response from a transfer

oracle_spec_for_settlement_price.description: The oracle spec describing the oracle data of settlement price

oracle_spec_for_trading_termination.description: The oracle spec describing the oracle data of trading termination

oracle_spec_binding.description: The binding between the oracle spec and the settlement price

changes.description: The updated configuration of the market

vega.UpdateMarket.title: Update Market
vega.UpdateMarket.description: Update an existing market on Vega

simple.description: Simple risk model parameters, valid only if MODEL_SIMPLE is selected

log_normal.description: Log normal risk model parameters, valid only if MODEL_LOG_NORMAL is selected

vega.UpdateMarketConfiguration.title: Update Market Configuration
vega.UpdateMarketConfiguration.description: Configuration to update a market on Vega

proposal_id.description: Identifier of the proposal being voted on

timestamp.description: Vote timestamp for date and time (in nanoseconds) when vote was submitted to the network

total_governance_token_balance.description: Total number of governance token for the party that casted the vote

total_governance_token_weight.description: The weight of this vote based on the total of governance token

total_equity_like_share_weight.description: The weight of the vote compared to the total number of equity-like share on the market.

party_id.description: Unique party identifier of the user initiating the withdrawal

asset.description: The asset we want to withdraw funds from

ref.description: The reference which is used by the foreign chain to refer to this withdrawal

expiry.description: The time until when the withdrawal is valid

tx_hash.description: The hash of the foreign chain for this transaction

created_timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the network started to process this withdrawal

withdrawn_timestamp.description: Timestamp for when the withdrawal was finalised by the network

vega.Withdrawal.title: Withdrawal
vega.Withdrawal.description: A withdrawal from the Vega network

chain_pub_key.description: Public key for the blockchain, required field

info_url.description: URL with more info on the node

country.description: Country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) for the location of the node

id.description: ID of the validator, (public master key)

from_epoch.description: The epoch from which the validator is expected to be ready to validate blocks

ethereum_signature.description: Signature from the validator made using the ethereum wallet

vega_signature.description: Signature from the validator made using the vega wallet

vega.commands.v1.AnnounceNode.title: Announce Node
vega.commands.v1.AnnounceNode.description: Used announce a node as a new potential validator

transfer_id.description: The ID of the transfer to cancel

vega.commands.v1.CancelTransfer.title: Cancel Transfer
vega.commands.v1.CancelTransfer.description: A request for cancelling a recurring transfer

node_id.description: The ID for the node to delegate to

amount.description: The amount of stake to delegate

vega.commands.v1.DelegateSubmission.title: Delegate Submission
vega.commands.v1.DelegateSubmission.description: A command to submit an instruction to delegate some stake to a node

market_id.description: Unique ID for the market with the liquidity provision to be amended

commitment_amount.description: From here at least one of the following is required to consider the command valid  an empty strings means no change

fee.description: an empty strings means no change

market_id.description: Unique ID for the market with the liquidity provision to be cancelled
Market identifier for the order, required field

commitment_amount.description: Specified as a unitless number that represents the amount of settlement asset of the market

fee.description: Nominated liquidity fee factor, which is an input to the calculation of taker fees on the market, as per setting fees and rewarding liquidity providers

sells.description: A set of liquidity sell orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

buys.description: A set of liquidity buy orders to meet the liquidity provision obligation

reference.description: A reference to be added to every order created out of this liquidityProvisionSubmission

vega.commands.v1.LiquidityProvisionSubmi.title: Liquidity Provision Submission
vega.commands.v1.LiquidityProvisionSubmi.description: A liquidity provision submitted for a given market

id.description: The identifier of the resource being signed

kind.title: Node Signature Kind
kind.description: The kind of the signature created by a node, for example, allow-listing a new asset, withdrawal etc

vega.commands.v1.NodeSignature.title: Node Signature
vega.commands.v1.NodeSignature.description: Represents a signature from a validator, to be used by a foreign chain in order to recognise a decision taken by the Vega network

deliver_on.description: A unix timestamp in second. Time at which the transfer should be delivered in the to account

vega.commands.v1.OneOffTransfer.title: One Off Transfer
vega.commands.v1.OneOffTransfer.description: Specific details for a one off transfer

payload.description: The data provided by the third party provider

vega.commands.v1.OracleDataSubmission.title: Oracle Data Submission
vega.commands.v1.OracleDataSubmission.description: Command to submit new Oracle data from third party providers

order_id.description: Order identifier, this is required to find the order and will not be updated, required field

market_id.description: Market identifier, this is required to find the order and will not be updated

price.title: All fields below can be altered by this command:
price.description: All fields below can be altered by this command:  Amend the price for the order, if the Price value is set, otherwise price will remain unchanged - See [`Price`](#vega.Price)

size_delta.description: Amend the size for the order by the delta specified: - To reduce the size from the current value set a negative integer value - To increase the size from the current value, set a positive integer value - To leave the size unchanged set a value of zero

expires_at.description: Amend the expiry time for the order, if the Timestamp value is set, otherwise expiry time will remain unchanged - See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`

time_in_force.title: Time In Force
time_in_force.description: Time In Force for an order See [What order types are available to trade on Vega?](https://docs.testnet.vega.xyz/docs/trading-questions/#what-order-types-are-available-to-trade-on-vega) for more detail

pegged_offset.description: Amend the pegged order offset for the order

pegged_reference.title: Pegged Reference
pegged_reference.description: A pegged reference defines which price point a pegged order is linked to - meaning the price for a pegged order is calculated from the value of the reference price point

vega.commands.v1.OrderAmendment.title: Order Amendment
vega.commands.v1.OrderAmendment.description: An order amendment is a request to amend or update an existing order on Vega  The `orderID`, `partyID` and `marketID` fields are used for looking up the order only and cannot be amended by this command

order_id.description: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus), required field

market_id.description: Market identifier for the order, required field

vega.commands.v1.OrderCancellation.title: Order Cancellation
vega.commands.v1.OrderCancellation.description: An order cancellation is a request to cancel an existing order on Vega

market_id.description: Market identifier for the order, required field

price.description: Price for the order, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places, , required field for limit orders, however it is not required for market orders

size.description: Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts, cannot be negative

side.title: Side
side.description: A side relates to the direction of an order, to Buy, or Sell

time_in_force.title: Time In Force
time_in_force.description: Time In Force for an order See [What order types are available to trade on Vega?](https://docs.testnet.vega.xyz/docs/trading-questions/#what-order-types-are-available-to-trade-on-vega) for more detail

expires_at.description: Timestamp for when the order will expire, in nanoseconds since the epoch, required field only for `Order.TimeInForce`.TIME_IN_FORCE_GTT` - See `VegaTimeResponse`.`timestamp`

reference.description: Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus, currently set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission

pegged_order.description: Used to specify the details for a pegged order - See `PeggedOrder`

vega.commands.v1.OrderSubmission.title: Order Submission
vega.commands.v1.OrderSubmission.description: An order submission is a request to submit or create a new order on Vega

terms.description: Proposal configuration and the actual change that is meant to be executed when proposal is enacted

vega.commands.v1.ProposalSubmission.title: Proposal Submission
vega.commands.v1.ProposalSubmission.description: A command to submit a new proposal for the Vega network governance

start_epoch.description: The first epoch from which this transfer shall be paid

end_epoch.description: The last epoch at which this transfer shall be paid

vega.commands.v1.RecurringTransfer.title: Recurring Transfer
vega.commands.v1.RecurringTransfer.description: Specific details for a recurring transfer

vega.commands.v1.RestoreSnapshot.title: Restore Snapshot
vega.commands.v1.RestoreSnapshot.description: A command that loads the state from a given checkpoint

algo.description: The algorithm used to create the signature.

version.description: The version of the signature used to create the signature.

vega.commands.v1.Signature.title: Signature
vega.commands.v1.Signature.description: A signature to authenticate a transaction and to be verified by the Vega network.

from_account_type.title: Account Type
from_account_type.description: Various collateral/account types as used by Vega

to.description: The public key of the destination account

to_account_type.title: Account Type
to_account_type.description: Various collateral/account types as used by Vega

amount.description: The amount to be taken from the source account

reference.description: The reference to be attached to the transfer

vega.commands.v1.Transfer.title: Transfer
vega.commands.v1.Transfer.description: A transfer initiated by a party

proposal_id.description: The ID of the proposal to vote for.

vega.commands.v1.VoteSubmission.title: Vote Submission
vega.commands.v1.VoteSubmission.description: A command to submit a new vote for a governance proposal.

vega.commands.v1.WithdrawSubmission.title: Withdraw Submission
vega.commands.v1.WithdrawSubmission.description: Represents the submission request to withdraw funds for a party on Vega

opening_auction.description: True if the event indicates an auction opening and False otherwise

leave.description: True if the event indicates leaving auction mode and False otherwise

start.description: Timestamp containing the start time for an auction

end.description: Timestamp containing the end time for an auction

trigger.title: Auction Trigger
trigger.description: Auction triggers indicate what condition triggered an auction (if market is in auction mode)

extension_trigger.title: Auction Trigger
extension_trigger.description: Auction triggers indicate what condition triggered an auction (if market is in auction mode)

vega.events.v1.AuctionEvent.title: Auction Event
vega.events.v1.AuctionEvent.description: An auction event indicating a change in auction state, for example starting or ending an auction

id.description: A unique event identifier for the message

block.description: The batch (or block) of transactions that the events relate to

type.title: Bus Event Type
type.description: An (event) bus event type is used to specify a type of event It has 2 styles of event: Single values (e.g. BUS_EVENT_TYPE_ORDER) where they represent one data item Group values (e.g. BUS_EVENT_TYPE_AUCTION) where they represent a group of data items

state_var.description: State variable consensus state transition update

erc20_multisig_set_threshold_event.description: ERC20 multi sig set threshold event

position_state_event.description: Position status for a party in a market

tx_err_event.description: Transaction error events, not included in the ALL event type

vega.events.v1.BusEvent.title: Bus Event
vega.events.v1.BusEvent.description: A bus event is a container for event bus events emitted by Vega

vega.events.v1.DelegationBalanceEvent.title: Delegation Balance Event
vega.events.v1.DelegationBalanceEvent.description: DelegationBalanceEvent - updates on the delegation balance of a party to a node in the current epoch in effect

signature_id.description: The ID of this signature bundle

submitter.description: The address of the submitter of the transaction

vega.events.v1.ERC20MulistSigSignerRemov.title: ERC 20 Mulist Sig Signer Removed Submitter

signature_id.description: The identifier of the signature bundle

validator_id.description: The vega node ID of the node to be added

timestamp.description: the time at which this happened

new_signer.description: The ethereum address of the new signer

submitter.description: The address of the submitter of the transaction

signature_submitters.description: A list containing all the IDs of bundle generated There should be one bundle generated for every validators in the validator set

validator_id.description: The vega node ID of the node which is to be removed

timestamp.description: the time at which this happened

old_signer.description: The ethereum address of the signer to be removed

vega.events.v1.ERC20MultiSigThresholdSet.title: ERC 20 Multi Sig Threshold Set Event

seq.description: Sequence number that increases by one each epoch

start_time.description: What time did this epoch start

expire_time.description: What time should this epoch end

end_time.description: What time did it actually end

old_pub_key.description: Old Vega public key of validator node

new_pub_key.description: New Vega public key of validator node

block_height.description: Height of the block where key rotation took effect

vega.events.v1.KeyRotation.title: Key Rotation
vega.events.v1.KeyRotation.description: A key rotation events contains information about Vega key rotation

party_id.description: Party identifier (public key) for the event

vega.events.v1.LossSocialization.title: Loss Socialization
vega.events.v1.LossSocialization.description: A loss socialization event contains details on the amount of wins unable to be distributed

payload.description: Payload is a unique information string

vega.events.v1.MarketEvent.title: Market Event
vega.events.v1.MarketEvent.description: MarketEvent - the common denominator for all market events interface has a method to return a string for logging

time.description: Timestamp containing latest update from Vega blockchain aka Vega-time

vega.events.v1.MarketTick.title: Market Tick
vega.events.v1.MarketTick.description: A market ticket event contains the time value for when a particular market was last processed on Vega

mark_price.description: Mark price as a string representing a scaled price

vega.events.v1.PositionResolution.title: Position Resolution
vega.events.v1.PositionResolution.description: A position resolution event contains information on distressed trades

party_id.description: Party identifier for this position update

market_id.description: Market identifier for this position update

vega.events.v1.PositionStateEvent.title: Position State Event
vega.events.v1.PositionStateEvent.description: A position state event contains the current position state for a single party in a single market

party_id.description: Party identifier (public key) for the event

margin.description: Margin value as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

price.description: Price as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places

vega.events.v1.SettleDistressed.title: Settle Distressed
vega.events.v1.SettleDistressed.description: A settle distressed event contains information on distressed trading parties who are closed out  Note: Any PositionResolution event (market level) will most likely be followed by a number of these events

party_id.description: Party identifier (public key) for the event

price.description: Price of settlement as a string

trade_settlements.description: A collection of 1 or more trade settlements

position_factor.description: Position factor - 10 ^ number of position decimal places

vega.events.v1.SettlePosition.title: Settle Position
vega.events.v1.SettlePosition.description: A settle position event contains position settlement information for a party

id.description: The internal ID for this staking event

ts.description: The timestamps at which the event was emitted by ethereum

party.description: The party to whom the event is directed at.

amount.description: The amount of stake deposited or removed

finalized_at.description: The time at which the vega network finalized the state of the event

tx_hash.description: The hash of the transaction from which the events happen

block_height.description: The block when the event happened

ethereum_address.description: the ethereum address from which the stake link was iniated

vega.events.v1.StakeLinking.title: Stake Linking
vega.events.v1.StakeLinking.description: StakeLinking - an event notifying of stake being deposited or removed for a given party These events are emitted for every Staking deposit or removed accepted by the network

vega.events.v1.StateVar.title: State Var
vega.events.v1.StateVar.description: StateVarEvent - updates on state changes in state variable consensus

timestamp.description: Timestamp containing latest update from Vega blockchain aka Vega-time

vega.events.v1.TimeUpdate.title: Time Update
vega.events.v1.TimeUpdate.description: A time update event contains the latest time update from Vega blockchain

vega.events.v1.TradeSettlement.title: Trade Settlement
vega.events.v1.TradeSettlement.description: A trade settlement is part of the settle position event

from_account_type.title: Account Type
from_account_type.description: Various collateral/account types as used by Vega

to_account_type.title: Account Type
to_account_type.description: Various collateral/account types as used by Vega

responses.description: One or more entries containing internal transfer information

vega.events.v1.TransferResponses.title: Transfer Responses
vega.events.v1.TransferResponses.description: A transfer responses event contains a collection of transfer information

party_id.description: Unique party identifier for the related party

err_msg.description: An error message describing what went wrong

previous_status.description: the status of the validator in the previous epoch

next_status.description: the status of the validator in the next epoch

epoch_seq.description: the epoch seq for which the status is valid

tm_voting_power.description: tendermint voting power of the validator

vega.events.v1.ValidatorRankingEvent.title: Validator Ranking Event
vega.events.v1.ValidatorRankingEvent.description: An event that explains the status of the validator for the coming epoch

vega.events.v1.ValidatorScoreEvent.title: Validator Score Event
vega.events.v1.ValidatorScoreEvent.description: ValidatorScoreEvent is the score a validator gets for a given epoch

vega_pub_key.description: Vega public key of validator node

ethereum_address.description: Ethereum public key of validator node

info_url.description: URL with more info on the node

country.description: Country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) for the location of the node

added.description: Flag indicating if the validator has been added to or removed from vega

from_epoch.description: The epoch from which the validator was added

vega.events.v1.ValidatorUpdate.title: Validator Update
vega.events.v1.ValidatorUpdate.description: A validator update event contains information about validator node
